page.title: 19Observatory
page.content: The Observatory stands on the edge of Crosland Heath golf course. It was completed in 1979 after four years of work. The telescope can magnify up to 1200 times. Its dome is 15 feet in diameter. When I looked through the telescope I could see a church steeple that was miles away and could only just be seen with the naked eye. The telescope has a 40cm mirror. When we went into the observatory we had to wear plastic overshoes to stop the dust getting onto the mirror. The observatory is run by the H.A.S.(Huddersfield astronomical society). It will be used to track Halley's Comet next year.
